content: the round you should now have 16 stitches total round 12 k2tog all the way around leaving 8 stitches cut the yarn leaving a 10 tail to finish with thread the end of the tail through a tapestry needle while keeping the stitches on the needles thread the tail through all 8 stitches take the needles out and pull the tail tightly to close the top of the hat weave the tail into the inside of the hat to keep it from unraveling use a technique that doesn t show through to the front of the hat weave the cast-on tail into the inside ⓒ may 2022 margaret billings 2 of the brim of the hat so that it does not unravel leave any extra tail left after weaving in attached to the hat until after blocking blocking blocking is the process of wetting a finished project and letting it dry in its final shape this helps all the fibers in the yarn settle into the stitches and makes everything look neat and smooth blocking also gives you an opportunity to wash off any crumbs grease pet hair or other gunk that got on the hat while you were knitting it it takes a little extra time but your work deserves a good finish materials ● wool wash or dish soap ● bowl big enough to submerge the hat ● towel ● a flat surface that won t be damaged by something wet sitting on it for a few hours directions 1 put a small amount of wool wash or dish soap in a bowl of cold water large enough to fully immerse the hat do not use regular laundry soap most laundry soaps have enzymes that will break down the proteins in wool and degrade it 2 submerge the hat try not to agitate it too much so that it doesn t felt 3 let the hat soak for 15-20 minutes 4 keeping the hat in the bowl dump out the soapy water refill the bowl with fresh water and gently slosh it around to rinse repeat this process if needed try not to agitate it here either 5 after dumping out the water from the last rinse gently press the hat against the side of the bowl to get out some water don t wring it out 6 lay the hat out on a dry towel roll the towel up with the hat inside and press on the roll to remove more water i step on it for this- it gets more water out with less effort on my part 7 unroll the towel and remove the hat lay the hat out flat on a surface that won t be damaged by water and leave it to dry completely don t leave it in the sun as this can discolor the wool 8 once it s totally dry trim the tails
